data.text: @CraigHartsough @azra_wi @MLevitt_NP2013 And since 90% doesnt use them properly even those FFP2 are bullshit.

@CraigHartsough @azra_wi @MLevitt_NP2013 Dude you can't be fuckin serious. The normal facemasks ar utterly bullshit and dont prevent anything. Stop spreading stupid Fakenews. Only FFP2 Masks, used perfectly are actually marginally protecting against an infection.

@MLevitt_NP2013 Oud nieuws
de aanbeveling is ook draag een katoen masker en was het voor dat je het gaat dragen

@CraigHartsough @MLevitt_NP2013 If masks were effective, we wouldn’t need a vaccine. But then if the covid vaccines were effective, they wouldn’t be telling the vaxxed to mask up.

https://t.co/EUfWUwfav0

@R137K @HRenkel @PBarkes @MLevitt_NP2013 That isn't and wasn't my point and is irrelevant.

Again: Authors said (paraphrasing), "nothing here shows that the risks outweigh the benefits".  Dr. Levitt said (paraphrasing), "here's a paper that confirms my view that the risks outweigh the benefits."  He was wrong.
@CraigHartsough @HRenkel @PBarkes @MLevitt_NP2013 "The importance of wearing face masks against COVID-19 is unquestionable"

@R137K @HRenkel @PBarkes @MLevitt_NP2013 The authors aren't making a "claim", they are doing the opposite, making a *disclaimer* that their results should not be used for arguing against masks.  Dr. Levitt did so anyway, because he didn't actually read the paper.

@GeertKok4 @MLevitt_NP2013 Almost all the vaccine mandates have exemptions.  The strictest are in the health care and military, with good reason.

Also, it has nothing to do with the point I made: Dr. Levitt tried to support his view with an article that *explicitly* says not to use it that way.
@valyzamora @MLevitt_NP2013 I was a nurse for almost 2 decades working in hospital settings. We usually wear them for short periods of time, not hours and hours, day after day.
